alert.note: Alert for Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Southern Inner Channels (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 6:40PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...ANOTHER HEAT WAVE LIKELY THIS LATE WEEKEND INTO EARLY NEXT WEEK... Widespread hot temperatures are expected to develop again late this weekend with highs in the upper 70s into the 80s for the inner channels. Locations away from the water will be the warmest. Starting Sunday and continuing through the first half of the week, some locations of the Inner Channels could reach the upper 80s. Daily high temperature records will likely fall in some areas. To minimize impacts of the heat wave, locate fans for cooling; wear light-colored and loose fitting clothes; drink plenty of fluids, apply sun protection, and take breaks if you must be outdoors for extended periods; do not leave young children and pets unattended in closed vehicles; and plan to check on the elderly, those who are home-bound, and other loved ones and neighbors who could be more vulnerable. The very warm tempertures will also continue to produce snow and ice melt to keep larger rivers systems at high levels.
